neighbors.name: Bruce Randall Litton & Nell Litton
neighbors.claims: Bruce R. Litton and Nell Litton are associated with the ownership of a rural parcel in Floyd County (Parcel M16112), specifically located at 410 Biddy Rd SE, Rome, GA ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/410-Biddy-Rd-SE-Rome-GA-30161/91051335_zpid/)). Public records indicate Bruce Litton has been a resident of Rome, GA ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/l/bruce-litton/)). No references were found in local news archives or public meeting minutes indicating that the Littons have taken any public position on development or energy issues in Floyd County ([Floyd County Minutes](https://romega.gov/AgendaCenter/ViewFile/Minutes/_02012024-691)). They are not noted as serving in any elected or appointed community roles in Floyd County ([Floyd County Directory](https://www.floydcountyga.gov/bc/directory)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowners; no known public roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via local agricultural channels. Emphasize respect for property and rural lifestyle; listen to concerns to build trust.

neighbors.verification_notes: Confirmed M16112 corresponds to 410 Biddy Rd SE. While 'Nell Litton' is listed in the draft and some public data aggregators, some records suggest a Nell Litton may be deceased or living out of state; however, the name remains associated with the property record. Stance remains unknown.

neighbors.name: Jerry Martin
neighbors.claims: Jerry Martin is confirmed as the owner of Parcel M15019, located at 277 Gaines Biddy Rd in Rome, GA ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/277-Gaines-Biddy-Rd-Rome-GA-30161/114272241_zpid/)). There are no documented public statements by this specific Jerry Martin regarding land development or renewable energy in local media or meeting transcripts ([Floyd County Minutes](https://romega.gov/AgendaCenter/ViewFile/Minutes/_02012024-691)). While individuals with the name Jerry Martin appear in other regional records (including a photographer in Pell City and a former public works employee in Chattanooga), this individual does not hold any prominent public positions in Floyd County ([Floyd County Directory](https://www.floydcountyga.gov/bc/directory)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via mutual contact. Since views are private, focus on one-on-one listening and assurance of property rights respect.

citations.claim: Jerry Martin is confirmed as the owner of Parcel M15019, located at 277 Gaines Biddy Rd in Rome, GA

citations.title: Floyd County Boards & Commissions Directory

neighbors.verification_notes: Common name. Distinguished from 'Jerry Martin' in nearby counties (Liberty County official) and sex offender registry (Dodge County). The verified parcel M15019 is a residential single-family home.

neighbors.name: Herbert David Litton
neighbors.claims: Herbert David Litton (often going by David Litton) is recorded in Floyd County as associated with properties on Biddy Road ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/l/bruce-litton/)). Public records link the name David Litton to the address 410 Biddy Rd and 315 Biddy Rd SE ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/315-Biddy-Rd-SE-Rome-GA-30161/295435156_zpid/)). No evidence was found of Herbert David Litton personally speaking at public hearings or in local news on development issues ([Floyd County Minutes](https://romega.gov/AgendaCenter/ViewFile/Minutes/_02012024-691)). He holds no public office in the county and is not listed among local officials or board members ([Floyd County Directory](https://www.floydcountyga.gov/bc/directory)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out via farming networks. Emphasize landscape continuity and address land use concerns with assurances of open communication.

neighbors.verification_notes: NOTE: An 'Andrew Litton' spoke in FAVOR of a townhome rezoning application in Rome/Floyd County on Feb 1, 2024. While sharing a surname and potentially a household, Andrew is a distinct individual from Herbert David Litton. No specific stance for Herbert David was found.
